p: At Sadore, the cultivar CIVT on average produced 1188 kg ha − 1 of grain yield under baseline climate; whereas at Cinzana it produced 1321 kg ha − 1 ( Table 3). Overall effect of climate change (temp. + CO 2 + rain) by 2030 was 8% decrease in yield at Sadore and 11% increase at Cinzana. These changes in yields at both of these locations were statistically significant (p < 0.05) as compared to the baseline yields at the respective locations. Overall effect of climate change factors (temperature + CO 2 + rainfall) by 2050 was significant (p < 0.05) decrease in yield at Sadore (− 14%) and non-significant increase at Cinzana (4%). In spite of some reduction in rainfall during July at Cinzana, the increasing trend in yield at Cinzana could be attributed to overall better moisture regime with climate change at Cinzana than at Sadore.
